Strip commas in quoted strings, remove quotes and blank lines,  handle table titles, deal with different csv blocks
From the parsed attributes, read the scalar value in "Reports with $ Loss" and cast it to numeric.
Locate the embedded sub-table "Reported Fraud Losses in $1 - $1000 Range" and iterate over its rows.
Within that sub-table sum the counts whose loss-range label is one of: $1-$100, $101-$200, $201-$300, $301-$400, $401-$500 to get the total below $500.
Compute the proportion of fraud reporters who lost between $1–$500 by dividing total_below_500 by total_reports and print the resulting float.
